summary: Frontend testing PASSED - All load-based thermal and variable current features working correctly. Tested Cobra 29 (slow heating ~0.3°C/s due to low loadRatio ~0.09) vs Ranger RCI-2970 (fast heating ~3.2°C/s with loadRatio ~1.0). Variable current shows actual draw (4.6A/50A for Cobra, 50A/50A for Ranger) instead of rated max.
passed_tests: Load-based thermal: Cobra 29 (1W) + 2-pill driver heats SLOWLY at ~0.3°C/s (expected ~0.27°C/s due to loadRatio 0.09) - PASS
Load-based thermal: Ranger RCI-2970 (12W) + 2-pill driver heats FAST at ~3.2°C/s (expected ~3°C/s with loadRatio ~1.0) - PASS
Variable current: Cobra 29 + 2-pill driver DRAW shows 4.6A/50A when keyed (expected ~4.5A) - PASS
Variable current: DRAW shows 0A/50A when NOT keyed - PASS
Variable current: Final amp DRAW shows 38A/100A (proportional to its load ratio) - PASS
Multi-cycle thermal: Temperature continues across key-down/un-key cycles correctly - PASS
TempBar thresholds correct: max at 175°C, colors at 60/100/150°C - PASS
MetricsPanel Amp Temp meter max=150 (175-25) correct - PASS
critical_code_review_comments: calculateStageOutputs() in rfEngine.js correctly calculates loadRatio as (output / maxCapacity)
RFContext.js correctly applies loadRatio to both heat rate and current draw
EquipmentRack.js DRAW format shows 'actualAmps/ratedAmps' correctly using keyed state
Thermal mass sqrt(transistors/2) formula working - 2-pill heats faster than 4-pill
All thermal constants correct: BLOW_TEMP=175, HEAT_BASE_RATE=3, COOL_RATE=2
context_for_next_testing_agent: Load-based thermal model fully verified. Key formulas: loadRatio = stageOutput / stageMax, heatRate = HEAT_BASE_RATE / thermalMass * loadRatio * stressFactors, actualCurrent = ratedCurrent * loadRatio. Cobra 29 (1W) barely loads 2-pill (550W max) so loadRatio~0.09, heats slowly. Ranger (12W) fully loads it, heats at ~3°C/s. All thermal features continue working correctly.

load_based_thermal_results.comparison: Ranger heats ~10x faster than Cobra due to 10x higher loadRatio
